Reviews.Title: Other things to consider before buying!
Reviews.Author: mikkblai
Reviews.Content: This isn't a horrible TV by any means, picture is decent, and everything works as it should.  However... for an $580 TV I have found quite a few things I am very unhappy with, that I didn't really consider before buying.-the TruSound feature had to be turned off within the first two hours... horrible volume fluctuation at the wrong times...-from the time you push the power button expect about 15 seconds before you see a picture (seriously I counted)-once the picture is up...expect another 2-3 seconds for any sound-the same is true for changing channels, NO QUICK SCANNING, its takes about 7 second start to finish one channel to the next, after you enter the channel about 5 second before it turns, then another second or 2 before there is a picture, and yet another couple seconds before there is any sound.  **THIS SEEMS LIKE AN ETERNITY WHEN YOU ARE SWITCHING BETWEEN CHANNELS OR SURFING.-my other complaint is the volume control... there needs to be at least three more volume numbers between one and 5.  One is able to be heard easily from the next room.  TWO is already almost too loud if your the only activity in the house.  3,4, and 5 show very little fluctuation in sound, which I wish was the case for 0-3!

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Great Price
Reviews.Author: H. Berman "blazedog"
Reviews.Content: I am not a videophile and have pretty basic viewing criteria.I did a fair amount of research but realized that most of what people were discussing on the forums would be meaningless to me when I got the television home. I looked at televisions in person -- again, to my "untutored" eyes they all looked pretty much the same to me except for one house brand at Best Buys which truly did have an inferior picture even to my non-discerning eyes.I haven't noticed any sound discrepancy but then I can't remember the last time I actually watched a commercial since I watch everything through TIVO and fast forward through all the crap.I also don't notice much of a time lag between changing channels and I think any delay is probably relating to a cable box since this changes at the exact speed as my prior set.It does take about 10 seconds to warm up but that's hardly a huge issue in my life and I don't know whether other LCD sets have the same start up rates.The set was quite a bit cheaper than an equivalent set bought elsewhere - free scheduled delivery - the guy did attach the stand and turn it on but it was up to me to set up the rest which was fine. Delivery from Best Buy was quoted at $75.Vizio seems to be relatively reliable and reliability is somewhat of a crapshoot anyway since my highly rated SONY only lasted 5 years. Given the price differential between this set and its competitors, I'm sure I will be fine with my amortized usage.It's 60 mz - After researching I determined that my viewing habits had no need for 120 since I don't watch sports. Sound is no better or worse than any television and I might see if I can hook it up to my unused BOSE CD player.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I am very pleased with my purchase. I do however agree with the previous poster. The sound fluctuation can be a bit annoying between commercials, inputs, and channels. My last TV did this, so it doesn't bother me too much. Also, there is no sound delay (picture and audio not matching) this was a big concern for me, I have a friend with a 52" Sony Bravia and another with a 47" LG that both are slightly off. For a 42" 1080p less than $600 I couldn't pass this up.I would recommend if you don't mind changing the volume from time to time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Jared Giese "Jared Giese"
Reviews.Content: I got this for Black Friday at Sams Club and this is an excellent TV.*HD picture is one of the best I have seen*Easy to use menu system*Good speakersThe only bad thing I have noticed is the TruSound which I turned off. It tries to increase volume and decrease volume depending on what is going on in the show or movie, overall it was too annoying and once turned off it helped a lot. The actual speaker quality is one of the best I have heard without external speakers.I gave this a 5/5 because the TruSound volume feature is easily disabled, therefor, should not affect the rating.

Reviews.Title: Great Performance and Value
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this Vizio is fantastic - and I have another 1080 HD set I am comparing it with.  I also have no problem watching football and even hockey with 60 Hz performance as found on this TV.  We did experience the sound fluctuation problems reported by others, but this was resolved by turning OFF the sound "enhancement" features in the on screen menu.  I highly recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: T. Dahm "tdfl"
Reviews.Content: Love the TV. Only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't have audio out connector, to hear the TV tuner sound through my surround sound system. The HDMI port works great when playing DVD's, but no audio out for regular TV signal.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A  Story
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, beautiful picture and easy setup.  No sound issues at all. Non-glare screen, even in a sunny room. We didn't even realize it had USB inputs for flash drives.  We are still discovering features it has.  We highly recommend this product, we got the Amazon cyber Monday price !

Reviews.Title: Great Video, but sound problems
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Tomasi "Upper Cervical  Advocate"
Reviews.Content: We ordered this product before it was available. Sounded like just what we needed. We loved the virtual sound, and the high quality video and HD quality.Downsides are that the TV just shuts off with no warning. The volume will go way down, but will not respond to the  volume controls to increase.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420VA 42-inch full HD 1080 LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a HD TV, I had narrowed my selection down to VIZIO and LG. I read the reviews, where ever I could find them. Seemed like the only negative comments about the VIZIO was that it was slow coming on, and the volume changed becoming louder with need to lower the sound, or mute, then raise the sound volume back up. I liked the price of the VIZIO vs the LG, and decided to go with the VIZIO HDTV. It does take 15 to 20 seconds to come on, which I find acceptable. and initially the volume did fluctuate for about the first week, then there was no longer a problem with it. I do not know what corrected the sound issue, but it was not a big issue when I first got it. I just recently add HD TV service and I find the picture quality truly amazing. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good quality, good priced HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV for a very nice price
Reviews.Author: D. White "small town"
Reviews.Content: The Vizio 42 in HD TV is a wonderful bargain. With very cheap shipping and no local sales tax, we are very happy with our purchase. The TV has a great picture and sound. No problems. Another good purchase from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: cgdrennan
Reviews.Content: I got this tv back in October 2010 and it has worked great so far! I paired it with a vizio blu ray player and it looks great! I also use my MacBook pro hooked up through hdmi and it looks amazing. The sound is great for a tv speaker.. The volume fluctuates kinda weird but it's no big deal because I use other speakers when I want better sound quality. One thing I do recommend is to turn the smooth motion feature completely off. It makes blu rays look really weird and it makes the camera seem like it moves funny. It might be a preference thing but everyone that I have talked to doesn't like it. Go vizio!

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend!
Reviews.Author: Ninjalilly "sparklenshine"
Reviews.Content: Had I seen mikkblai's great review, I wouldn't have purchased. The contrast between the volume of a program and the commercials is huge. Some reviewers say this doesn't bother them, but I don't like the fact that I have to constantly hold the remote while watching, otherwise, the commercial will blast through the house like you went from volume level 1 to 100 in one swoop. You have to either mute it or lower it significantly during commercials, then you have to raise the volume significantly to hear the progam dialog. But its not only a problem between program and commercials! During a progam, if music plays, it too will become ridiculously loud, so you again have to play with the remote, because once the music dies down, you will need to turn it up again to hear what people are saying...annoying! It did help a little when I turned the SRS trusound off completely. Its also true that it takes quite a while to turn the set on and quite a while to change a channel. Now, the speakers are not working at all. The TV was on for about 2 minutes and the speakers stopped. I thought I had accidentally muted it, but no. The picture is fine, but many TVS have a good picture these days. I don't feel that this is good for the price. This one is more along the lines of "you get what you pay for".  When looking online, I see Vizio Customer Service has a terrible reputation. I hope I will be lucky and not have a bad experience, but I am preparing for the worst.

Reviews.Title: Audio Board failed after 14 months
Reviews.Author: BryanP
Reviews.Content: The picture is pretty nice and I was happy with it until the sound gave out.  It now just produces a high pitch buzz through all possible outputs.  Vizio told me it needed a firmware update and sent me a thumbdrive.  It arrived 2 weeks later but didn't fix anything.  Unfortunately, it's no longer under warranty and doesn't have a way to bypass the audio board.  Be aware that the components are not built to last much past the warranty.

Reviews.Title: JHOPPER
Reviews.Author: jhopper
Reviews.Content: WAS VERY WELL PLEASE WITHE TV I ORDER THE PICTURE IS VERY SHARP OVERALL THIS IS A GREAT TV.I WOULD BUY ANOTHER ONE LIKE THIS ONE WHEN I NEED ANOTHER

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420VA 42-Inch Full HD 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. Carr
Reviews.Content: Arrived in perfect shape and easily installed in my bedroom on a wall bracket.  I like almost everything about this TV.  Of course, as expected, the sound is totally inadequate, same as all flat TVs. But the optical audio output allows my stereo system to provide great sound.  Picture is beautiful and the price couldn't be beaten. I'm totally happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Average quality but good value
Reviews.Author: Yousif A. Hassan
Reviews.Content: Full disclaimer: I've since returned this TV.Although lackluster in appearance, this TV presents a good value for the money, if you aren't particularly picky about quality.  I thought I could get by because I wanted a cheaper set, but in the end, the niggles with this product caused me to have to give it back.  However, I'm pretty hard to please so many people might be perfectly ok with this set.I like the price, the relative brightness, the easy-to-use menus, and the remote.  Also the packaging of this TV is first-rate and it was a breeze to open, unpack, and set up.  VIZIO has a really strong focus on making things easy.What I didn't like was the quality of the picture or the sound.The picture is actually decent, and the colors are surprisingly accurate even out of the box, but adjustments are limited, the sharpness is not very good, and off-angle viewing is worse than even what you'd expect for an LCD.  Gamma was way off and not adjustable.Still, I might have lived with the picture if the sound weren't terrible.  And by terrible I mean terrible.  Maybe I had a defective unit, but I had to raise and lower the volume constantly as it never stayed at the same level, even accounting for variances in the programming. Sometime the sound seemed completely muffled, and even turning up the volume was not helping much.  And the output quality of the sound was abysmal.  In many scenes, even ones with a quiet background and clear dialog, I couldn't understand what was being said.  My home theater needs stereo audio RCA and this TV only has a digital optical out... so I didn't try with my HT.  The solution here is to get a digital-to-analog converter of course, but it wasn't worth it for this TV.Overall, I think this is a good effort and excellent value proposition, if you can deal with the issues above.  Mileage varies and your setup may vary as well.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: 60's hippie girl
Reviews.Content: I already own the 55" Visio and love it. The 42" is wonderful too. No more fighting about who gets what TV. 4 HDMI slots is perfect for all our needs. The price was unbelievable on both my TVs. I went strictly on price and size of my first Visio and was not disappointed at all. Not worth spending extra for the Sony or Samsung in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Vizio set review 60 HZ
Reviews.Author: TMAN
Reviews.Content: Very Nice TV for the price, if you watch sports make sure you buy a TV with a minimum of 120HZ. If you don't watch sports save your money and buy a set that is 60HZ.I have 3 Vizio TV sets and would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: OK Picture but little else.
Reviews.Author: Saint V "doctorG"
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a flat panel TV, but the people who designed it forgot to put audio out.  This is important for a TV when you are receiving over the air broadcasts and I think there should be a big red sign saying, "WARNING" no sound output on this TV!!!!  I can't stand the fact the I have to watch the news and sports with the much inferior sound system of the TV and would not recommend anyone to but this.  It's ok that the component video doubles as RCA input.  It is not ok that there is no audio output.  The people I have told doubted this until they saw the TV with their own eyes, then they believe.  Buyer beware, if you need audio out from this TV, avoid it at all costs!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lee
Reviews.Content: This review is coming from someone who has owned a Vizio in the past and LOVED it.  I decided to buy my first online television and found Amazon had the best deal.  The TV arrived and I loved it BUT after a few days the sound would go from one extreme to another on its own. Reminded me of the old Phillips commercial when they first came out with sound control so that every time you changed the channel the volume would stay the same. This TV is not like that!  Within the first week, the sound started skipping and the words would become jumbled and the only way to get rid of it was to change the channel. Needless to say I called Amazon and had a replacement sent out (within the 30 days). Replacement arrived and sound was still horrible but I thought I would just deal with it because it wasnt worth the effort and not to mention I started to believe maybe it was the cable/connection on my end.  After the 30 days passed the TV started skipping again!  Now I am stuck and cannot return it.  I will be calling Vizio since I do believe it came with warranty (I hope) but never again will I be buying a TV without doing more research and I will make sure the return period is more than 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price, but be prepared for some glitches
Reviews.Author: railfan
Reviews.Content: Nice picture.  Good sound.  However, the Motorola HD Cablebox kept causing it to reboot.  So there is something wrong with the HD processing that causes the TV to freeze then reboot.

Reviews.Title: poor picture, extremly fuzzy & blurry
Reviews.Author: Lupita Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: bought a new flat hd antenna as well hoping it would help but its the TV that's no good. i do not recommend this product. also sale price was a sales tactic because shipping cost was more than the cost of the TV so i ended up paying $500 for a s****y product.

Reviews.Title: Just in time
Reviews.Author: pgowersr
Reviews.Content: Had to have a new set for the NFL season, so I could see the games.A great deal and performance to match.All I own are Vizio TVs

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Myriad
Reviews.Content: TV arrived quickly, within about 3 days! exactly as described, works great! Would now hesitate to do business again with legacy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio, a new kind of garbage
Reviews.Author: Douknowme
Reviews.Content: This Vizio TV has turned out to be a piece of crap. The audio inputs are not working properly and Vizio.com tech support is a waste of time as they try to make you drag along with their horrible "we want you to try something else before we send out a service tech." I've complied with all their request and they promised a replacement set since I'm still in the one year original warranty. I've had upgrades to the firmware, five receivers on it (all work fine on another Vizio set we bought in December 2011), four HDMI cables, a Component set of cables, and it still gets a "No Signal."  After the first problem showed up about June 5th, they've been horrible. I'm tired of the tech people in Utah being rude so I'm doing something about it.November 21, 2012 update: This Vizio TV has improved 90% by my purchase of Componant cables as the vidio & audio carrier. It WOULD NOT allow a HDMI hookup. The component cables show a line going vertical up the screen but it's better than the TV constantly shutting off. Now, the other Vizio that I mentioned in the first rating is shutting off since it has an HDMI attached to it. I'll never buy VIZIO again.FYI: When we had a satelite service we had no problems. Just since switching to cable in April of 2012, we had major problems. VIZIO and cable do not seem to go together.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Melinda L. Tanner "good literature"
Reviews.Content: The picture is stunning, even when on You Tube. This TV works great, so far. I was worried about all the usual Vizio problems-exploding TV's and so on. But, so far it's working fine, and after a few problems I was able to hook it up to an old HP desktop I had sitting around. NOTE: If you are looking to hook your Vizio up to a desktop without HDMI, get a DVI to HDMI converter. Also, look on the back of your computer-I didn't realize that my HP had not one-but TWO DVI connectors. If one doesn't work, chances are the other will. However, without that slight problem, this TV is great. Also, I didn't need a sound bar or 5.1 speaker set up to get GREAT sound on this TV. When I'm just watching TV, it works great. All in all, a purchase I've been very pleased with.

Reviews.Title: consider this
Reviews.Author: austin simon
Reviews.Content: The picture is one of the best for the money hands down.the sound is crisp and clear.....Although it has a problemthe build is acceptableVolume on this tv is nonexistent it really seems to have normal listing volume loud and really loud ...there is no quiet setting you really cant have it to where someone wont hear it in another room its really oddalso the cable set up if just putting a straight line in to it no box but basic cable youll be upset it sucksi only got about 30 maybe 40 channels and there is only 2 setting to switch between no many options on setting the cable up to scan for channelsso its probably great when hooked up to an hd cable boxoverall great picture but strange quirks come with it you may not be able to handle like myself

Reviews.Title: 2nd Vizio added to our house, LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: JenniferZ
Reviews.Content: The colors are great, bought this for our bedroom.  Has USB input for looking at photos.  Perfect clarity.  I recommend Vizio.  Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, great service through Amazon
Reviews.Author: phunyfarm
Reviews.Content: Good value!  Don't expect this one to last 28 yrs. like my old NEC analog. It has been a good purchase in a time when everything is becoming outdated before it comes out of the box. No problems @ all after +/- 8 months.Has alot a capabilities we don't even use & we're still happy campers!

Reviews.Title: Good TV / Good Price
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this one year ago today for my bedroom. I had went through two other brands before finally deciding this is the one I wanted to keep. I have been very satisfied with the TV. It is nothing compared to my 65 inch in the living room but it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Ellen J. Baker "pogoe"
Reviews.Content: This TV is the best.  I love it, the picture is clear, it arrived safely and the price was very fair, free shipping to my door.  Can't ask for better than that.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42" Attribute Review
Reviews.Author: Parker511
Reviews.Content: Product is absolutely wonderful; you couldn't ask for more for such a reasonable price; added the HDMI cord and the picture is absolutely beautiful. I am completely satisfied with this purchase. It was delivered to my home in 2 days without even asking for a rushed delivey. I'm pleased about everything.

Reviews.Title: OK for an extra room TV
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This is a 3rd HDTV for our house, not the primary unit watched and it was purchased mainly for the special price on Amazon. The picture quality is not nearly as sharp as the others I have. Plus, within the warranty period, the audio went completely out. I will say that Vizeo's response was great and they had the HDTV fixed promptly and all the personel I dealt with were courteous and capable. If you're looking for an HDTV for the primary watching area, spend a little more, but this one's fine for casual watching.

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV. Clear, crisp picture.
Reviews.Author: angelmom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy this TV.  It replaced an older projection TV that we thought had a great picture but this is crisper, clearer.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: JLMartini
Reviews.Content: Great TV, just the right size. Games look sweet! Wish there were more lighting options for the screen, but other then that I'm happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Renata Mohammed
Reviews.Content: The TV quality is beautiful and we love all the features. We can even hook our Lap Tops or Flash drives into it and display picture slide shows or watch movies.

Reviews.Title: vizio performance so far
Reviews.Author: sj
Reviews.Content: I just bought this tv a few weeks ago and so far i couldn't be happier. The picture quality is the best i've seen besides the samsung tvs. This one is the most affordable for the size and the quality. I am noticing some issues with the sound that people have been complaining about, but it doesn't really bother me because they aren't too terribly bad.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV (and company) ever!
Reviews.Author: Kelly West
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV - never having owned a Vizio before. It worked for 5 months and then the volume stopped working. It just has a humming noise -- you can't hear anything on the TV. Prior to the volume breaking completely, the volume would randomly get soft and loud while watching. It was very frustrating but I dealt with it until one day the only sound coming out of the TV was a buzz. I had the 1 year warranty, so I called Vizio. They said they didn't recognize the serial number on the TV and I would need an original purchase receipt and that once I faxed it to them -- a repair man would come look at the TV in 7-10 days. I faxed that to them a week ago and can't get them to return my calls. I also bought a Vizio Blu-Ray DVD player which only worked one day. I read online that many people have had Vizio Blu-Rays that only worked a couple of days. Needless to say, I'm very disappointed and will never buy (or recommend) a Vizio product. Spare yourself the headache and spend a little extra money on a product from a more reputable company.

Reviews.Title: Vizio e420ev LCD tv
Reviews.Author: fred@foo
Reviews.Content: Overall the TV works OK. The display is excellent however it takes a long time to change between channels and the TrueVolume works opposite of what you would expect. Instead of balancing out the volume between shows and commercials, it enhances the commercials even more to the point that the TV is not useable. You have to mute the commercials or keep changing the volume setting.Overall, I would not recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: BUYERS BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY
Reviews.Author: D. Twaddle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this "TV" in April 2011 and had to return it within two weeks...I received the second one thanks to Amazon...and then to my dismay I began a nightmare of the first kind.  I am 70 yrs old....technically have one foot in the 21st century of technology...at first the sound would come on full blast and you would have to lower it....then after awhile when you went to lower it the "TV" would shut off...in the meanwhile I thought that perhaps there was some button I needed to set or something and we had Direct TV (another story)...everytime there is a storm I would have to call Direct TV and go through the routine of plug/unplug-move hdmi to port 2 etc...anyone with Direct TV knows the routine.....then I finally had enough when the Direct TV man came out and said that my 4 hmdi ports were NO GOOD I had better call the company....well he plugged whatever and I had a working picture once again.  I call VIZIO...NOT ONCE BUT TWICE....and being honest I told the entire story including that we had had a storm (no lightening) and the power went out and Direct TV said to call VIZIO....well the guy from Vizio did a TAP DANCE ROUTINE AROUND THE FACTORY POLICY said I should have called in the sound problems I was having before, and was I sure that I bought a NEW TV not a referbrished one!  AND IN SO MANY WORDS TOLD ME "I WAS SCREWED"...they would not be responsible because of the storm!....SO BEFORE ANYONE ELSE HAPPENS TO BE HONEST, TELLS THE TRUTH AND GET SREWED..........here I am writing my very first COMPLAINT TO ANYONE EVER.....hope it helps someone.

Reviews.Title: horrible tv
Reviews.Author: Mark Rouse
Reviews.Content: just terrible. the sound is awful, tv turns off randomly, and the picture goes in and out constantly - all in the first 5 months! do yourself a favor and stay away from vizio.

Reviews.Title: no improvement
Reviews.Author: marc
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set thinking on the brand name and the fact that I have purchased this brand before,having an excellent experience with the first set I purchased 4 years ago.I am somewhat dissapointed with the way this new set works,low quality sound,the remote control buttons are hard to control,the picture quality is not out the ordinary,if only I can find a set like the one I purchased from Vizio in 2007,I really do not know what are the technological advances in this new Tv set,I do not see them anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy a Vizio Product
Reviews.Author: Thomas Eversole
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware. Vizio company policies are misleading and dishonest. I bought from Vizio because the published specifications indicated a particular model VIZIO E420VA 42-Inch Full HD 1080p LCD HDTV, Black had certain inputs and outputs which were exactly what I needed (not just wanted). However, these specifications, given on their web site, in the Amazon link, and in the owner's manual (which I downloaded off the Internet before I bought), are wrong. When I called technical support to ask about this discrepancy I got the runaround. Evidently there are levels of support; Level 1 has only non-trained personnel reading from a script and who know nothing about the technical aspects of the televisions Vizio sells. Getting to Level 2, where the "technicians" know a little more, is very difficult and requires a very aggressive attitude. If there is a Level 3, it is not for us mere mortals.  When I inquired about how I would go about returning the set I bought, the Level 2 "technician" said that was beyond his authority, so he took my phone number and promised a manager/supervisor would call me back in five minutes. I waited for thirty minutes, then recalled technical support (starting again at Level 1). The new phone contact said he could do nothing either and demanded I give him the personal information Vizio required to register my purchase before a case number could be issued and a supervisor was able to contact me about my complaint. It was suggested that since the set was working a return would probably not be authorized. Evidently their lying about the features and specifications of their products is not sufficient reason to get a refund. I gave him the information and as of this writing more than twenty-four hours have passed and no one has called back.  I will never again by anything from Vizio. And I would caution anyone who is thinking about getting one of their products not to trust advertised claims and product descriptions. This company will do anything , say anything, and promise anything to get your money, which they will then hang on to with an unbreakable grip.  One other thing they do not tell you is that if you watch a non-HD channel through an HDMI input, there will be a very annoying and distracting thin band of white video noise across the top of the screen. You will never be able to know the limitations of Vizio products by looking at one of their sets in a retail setting. The closed circuit signal stores use to demonstrate the various models is deliberately designed to hype the good features and suppress the faults in Vizio products. Ignore completely what a salesman or company literature says - they are both lying. The only way you can be sure of what you are buying is to listen to someone who owns one. The one television manufacturer I have found to be honest with their customers is Samsung. Their products are more expensive, but that is for a good reason - they are worth it.
